page.title: 13RELIGION:THE GOSPEL HALL
page.content: The little chapel was built at Great Wenham 50 years ago.At that time it consisted of a worship area with a small entrance partitioned off and one room at the back.There is a baptistry at the front of the worship area under the flooring. In the early 1970's the chapel was improved by building cloakrooms and an entrance area.The worship area was enlarged to seat about 70..People attend from several of the surrounding villages.Congregations now often exceed 70 so land has been purchased in Capel and planning permission obtained to build a new church there. During the Easter holidays together with the parish church a holiday Bible club is run for children of the surrounding villages.Regular services are held on Sunday mornings and evenings and Sunday school at 9.45a.m.
